snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders said they would extend the regulations — which cover about one million apartments in the city — to safeguard tenants who have been without such protections since Monday.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and legislative leaders say they will extend rent regulations by five days; rules cover one million apartments in New York City; talks on permanent solution continue.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and SUSANNE CRAIG
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Albany, and Kate Zernike from New Jersey.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders said they would extend the regulations — which cover about one million apartments in the city — to safeguard tenants who have been without such protections since Monday.

headline.main: New York Legislature Agrees to 5-Day Extension of Rent Regulations
headline.print_headline: Legislature Agrees to 5-Day Extension of Rent Regulations but No Long-Term Deal
